Title:
A new stromata-producing Neotyphodium species symbiotic with
clonal grass Calamagrostis epigeios (L.) Roth. grown in China.
Abstract:
We describe a new stromata producing Neotyphodium species
symbiotic with clonal Calamagrostis epigeios (L.) Roth.. Stromata on the
grass 47.5¨C186 mm long, occurred frequently, but neither perithecium
nor mature ascus was observed. Morphology of fungal isolates obtained
from symptomatic and asymptomatic tillers were identical to each other,
and similar to those of epichloë endophytes. In phylogenetic analysis,
all selected 5 fungal isolates clustered into a significantly distinct
clade based on sequences of Â-tubulin gene (tubB) introns and
translation elongation factor 1-Á gene (tefA) introns with bootstrap
values of 99 %, supporting erect of a new species. Concerning about the
production of extremely long stromata on the host plants and absence of
sexual spores, we propose ¡°Neotyphodium stromatolongus Y. Ji, L. Zhan
et Z. Wang, sp. nov.¡± for this new species.
